data.title: [request] String method to get a RegEx capture array easier - the current approach is long and confusing
data.body:
Currently getting a regex match result array in godot from a string is long and a little bit confusing.
Example:
```
# the goal is to get "tests" from the string
var newTabPath =  "F:\stuff\godot\godot\BatShit\IM-experiments\tests\bluerun4 - Copy.png"
var newTabNameFromFolder = RegEx.new() #create new regex variable
newTabNameFromFolder.compile('.*\\\\(.*)\\\\.*[.][A-Za-z0-9]{2,4}',9) ## \ is \\(regex) is \\\\(regex here)
newTabNameFromFolder.find(newTabPath)
print("capture from: ",newTabPath )
print("-->capture from regex:",newTabNameFromFolder.get_captures()[1])
```

My proposal is to add a function to the string class that makes that route shorter
An example of that in another scripting language (AHK):

```
myString := "F:\stuff\godot\godot\BatShit\IM-experiments\tests\bluerun4 - Copy.png"
RegExMatch(myString, "(.*)\\", SubString) 
msgbox, result is : SubString[1]
```
https://autohotkey.com/docs/commands/RegExMatch.htm

following that approach and transferring it to godot, I am proposing this:

```
var newTabPath =  "F:\stuff\godot\godot\BatShit\IM-experiments\tests\bluerun4 - Copy.png"
var resultArr = newtabPath.RegexMatch('.*\\\\(.*)\\\\.*[.][A-Za-z0-9]{2,4}',9) ## this returns an array of matches
print("result is: ",resultArr[1]) #we get the first item from the result array if there is only one match
```
Proposed method for the String class:
StringArray RegexMatch(String pattern, int capture=9 )

data.title: Holding Gamepad D-Pad does not repeat event

**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
3.0 master Linux with Logitech F710

**Issue description:**
Changing focused element with D-Pad or changing Sliders value is tedious because player need to tap direction multiple times.

data.title: MeshDataTool get_vertex_count() returns the count of tris instead of verteces.
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
OS: Manjaro 17.0.1 Gellivara
Kernel: x86_64 Linux 4.9.30-1-MANJARO
CPU: Intel Celeron G1840 @ 2x 2.8GHz 
GPU: Mesa DRI Intel(R) Haswell Desktop 
RAM: 1416MiB / 3827MiB

Godot v2.1.3.stable.official


**Issue description:**
When using get_vertex_count() from the mesh generated with create_from_surface() the array returned has almost twice the amount of vertices it should have.

Comparing it to Blender data displayed, the number matches the amount of tris in the mesh, which obviously is way off. When I attempt to place other nodes on the vertices locations there are 2 or 3 copies all grouped in the same location because of this issue.

**Steps to reproduce:**
1. Load a mesh into a meshInstance (or import a scene).
2. Create a new MeshDataTool and mesh_from_surface, then get the vertex count.
3. print the array size and compare.

**Link to minimal example project:**

I can provide one if requested.

data.title: Add settings to pan canvas editor with scrolling
data.body:
This feature is mainly designed for developers who uses touchpad instead of mouse, and want to scroll instead of zoom. Every macOS developers will like it since it feels intuitive.

2 new settings are added to “editors/2d”:

scroll_to_pan: turn on to use mouse/touchpad scroll to pan canvas item editor view instead of zoom
pan_speed: use this value to change scroll speed

data.title: Support for multiple screens (Split scenes / gdscript)
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
2.1.3

I have tried to search for this, but have not been able to find this issue (I do not see why it wouldn't already be an existing issue!)

What is preventing us from adding support for using multiple windows with different monitors?

**Use case example:**
I would like to be able to split up my Node and GDScript windows - or have multiple GDScripts up at the same time on each screen.

I really hope this have been posted previously, and I just couldn't figure out the search terms. :)

data.title: Continue improving GDNative
data.body:
I should have submitted this last week this before going in vacation :sleeping: 

- Rename paramters in Array/Pool/Dictionary to keep consistency with the rest of the API
- Add missing properties in rect3, quat and transform
- Remove deprecated `GODOT_VARIANT_TYPE_INPUT_EVENT`
- Replace `godot_*_new_copy` by `godot_*_copy` function (simpler API, and imo more logical to consider this function as an object "method" than a standalone constructor)
- Replace Dictionary/Pool/Array item access by pointer by `set/get` functions.

@karroffel Considering the last point, I saw you [changed `godot_array_get`](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/commit/f23b56e3ecc5de8fc823dfa1c63f71d51ea12993#diff-2baa93f0b5a9942e8f39c1d7c1784faeR62) to return a pointer. I don't get the need for this (I would say it allow to be a bit faster because we can call the function once and only work on the pointer then, but it's also less user friendly than a get/set).

I've reverted to the get/set solution right now because it's what use Pythonscript right now. However I'm willing to change this PR and Pythonscript if you think your solution is better ;-)

data.title: Allow path auto-completion for single-quote delimited strings in the editor (for node paths and file paths)
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Fedora 25 - Godot 3.0 master

**Issue description:**
Auto-Completion of path strings in the editor is limited to double quotes, which require an unnecessary trip to the Shift key. With the addition of the scalar ($) symbol as syntactic sugar, this inconvenience has become much more pronounced.

As far as I know GDScript does not distinguish between single and double quotes for strings (e.g. literals in bash and char data types in C). This is the pull request [that added single quotes](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/pull/823/files), and it seems to handle the two equally.

The discussion from [this solved issue](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/issues/468) makes me think this is just an oversight and should be at least added for consistency.


**Steps to reproduce:**
`get_node('Spatial')` works as intended, but the editor does not provide completion suggestions for the path.

**Link to minimal example project:**
n/a

data.title: Fix build error on master, commit f8d7670
Spatial::rotate() can scale objects!?
data.body:
As a new user, I was giving rotate() wrongly-formed vectors (they weren't normalized), except instead of a crash or warning, my object shrank, which was very unexpected.

I would have expected auto-normalization, a warning, or an error, but not scaling!

Example:
Repeatedly call `rotate(Vector3(0.2,0,0), 0.05)` and watch your object spin and shrink.

Arch Linux - Godot 2.1.3
See also: #8113

data.title: Allow using import tools from command line
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Godot 2.1.3+

**Issue description:**
Allow using import tools from command line so Godot users can create scripts and automatize assets import.

For example:

- I could develop some scripts to help me refresh a group of fonts given a JSON configuration file, instead of manually re-importing one by one.
- I could batch import multiple images as textures, from multiple directories, and use the same script over and over as I update the source images.
- Have an script to monitor original images and watch for changes, automatically importing the assets as textures.

**Steps to reproduce:**
n/a

**Link to minimal example project:**

data.title: Right Click Resource to Load New Image, Material, etc...
data.body: I like the new resource button and how you no longer need to click on an arrow to edit what ever resource you are wanting to work on, but this feature should only appear when left clicking. A right click on the resource should bring up the options menu, where you can load another resource file or make a new one. The new down arrow button on smaller screens/none maximized windows is harder to click on. Distinguishing between LMB and RMB would make development a nanosecond faster and would make using the engine more comfortable.

data.title: rename add_child to add_node
data.body:
I think adding a **node** might be a better naming convention.
When you add, it is pretty obvious, that it is added as a **child**.
When adding a node I also always type in add_no... and than am confused why autocomplete is not proposing anything.

The main point though is: that get_node also is relative to the current node.
this is not consistent:
```
add_child(test_node)
get_node("test_node")
```
 this would be consistent:
```
add_node(test_node)
get_node("test_node")
```

data.title: [TRACKER] Making terrains
data.body:
I found a number of issues about making terrains in Godot, be it heightmap, voxels, an engine module or a plugin, so I thought I would make a tracker to list them all:

Engine limitations:
- #9008 : needs texture arrays / 3D texture support in shaders, for efficient texture painting
- #7786 : needs ability to do custom LoD that works in multiple viewports (currently limited to _process on a single viewport), so that the renderer doesn't chugs on culling and drawing the whole landscape
- #8994, #5624 : scenes and resources saved even without changes, with a terrain it can freeze the editor for seconds and become very annoying. I disabled Ctrl+S saving the scene for that reason.
- #6869 : LoD cannot update in editor because camera is not easily available. Current workaround is to use the camera provided in `_forward_spatial_input`.
- [tbd] : HeightmapShape would be nice for efficient collisions, because mesh colliders are resource-hungry (althought they work decently if limited to a small region)
- [tbd] : needs custom streamed resource so that a terrain doesn't have to be fully loaded in memory (only required lods around player), speeding loading times (the engine probably supports it already though, for sound)
- #9134 : needs 2 additional Vector4 vertex attributes for texturing (weights and indices), in order to exploit texture arrays. The current workaround is to use UV2, COLOR or BONE WEIGHT attributes, but it limits available attributes a lot.
- ~~[tbd] : indirect drawing of meshes (glDrawIndirect on renderer side, also supported in GLES3) to draw multiple subsets of mesh arrays so that we can swap LoDs really fast and reduce the amount of draw calls for all chunks of the terrain. _This also gives the opportunity to bake chunks for good, to a point they don't need any remeshing as lods update_ (current method has an exploding number of remeshing)~~ (not in GLES3 core... https://www.khronos.org/registry/OpenGL-Refpages/gl4/html/glDrawElementsIndirect.xhtml)
- [tbd] : Editor: add an undo history memory limit, or use file caching, because terrain edition generates a lot of undo memory
- #9571 : need to be able to update a texture partially. Editing huge textures on the CPU makes terrain editing unbearable on huge sizes (although GPU painting can be investigated to some extent).

User requests:
- #3616, #8124, #8254, #4304
In several occurences my GDScript plugin was mentionned, however it has reached a point where GDScript is so slow and the API limited enough that it needs a port to C++, currently work in progress: https://github.com/Zylann/godot_heightmap_module
That module may eventually come with a fork PR of the engine in order to add missing features so everyone can benefit from them, and _things specific to terrains will stay in the module_.

data.title: GodotCoin
data.body:
Good day to all!
I've been following the project for a long time. And I see that the team has some financial problems with some periodicity. People donate money more willingly to training material on the engine (beautifully designed) than on the engine itself. And the developers of the engine is always without money. It's time to put an end to it (at least try).

What I suggest:
   1 To create a crypto currency. Crypto-currencies are gaining momentum and this is obvious. They no longer will not go anywhere. Yes, the competition is now huge. But you can still jump in the outgoing car.
   2 Money to spend on the development of the engine, training material and free games for the community
   3 If the project succeeds in sponsoring other open projects (accepting applications from them and allocating money to them)
   4 Maybe something else.

What you need for this:
   1 Crypto currency. For example, based on https: //cryptonote.org
   2 Well-designed advertising company (you can ask Nathan Lovato for the design and submission of the material)
   3 Little bit of luck
Who thinks anything about this?

data.title: Can't check the type of event from _input
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Debian 9 - Godot 3.0 (Commit 8126a0c)

**Issue description:**
With the changes of InputEvent the syntax for `_input(event)` should be:

    func _input(event):

        print(event)

        # or without the parenthesis, it doesn't work either way.
        if (event extends InputEventMouseMotion):
            print("event is mouse motion!")

But that triggers `error: ':' expected at end of line`, which is not helpful because ':' is present at end of line.

If I use `if event is InputEventMouseMotion:` it works, but then there is no way to get the position of the event.

data.title: [3.0] ButtonArray is unusable with the new theme if only icons are used
data.body:
I'm trying to make an editor plugin that uses a ButtonArray to select a mode, however I noticed it's impossible to tell which button is selected if they are icons (typical when they are used as exclusive tool buttons):

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1311555/26758361/e5539ea2-48db-11e7-8e85-b783ee2eba6a.png)
Here is a ButtonArray with 5 icon buttons, the first one is selected.

ButtonArray is not used in other plugins, which use ToolButtons, manually making them exclusive, which is not nice because ButtonArray exists and should do this job nicely.
use 2.1

data.title: Rect3 pos to position
data.body: same as #9019

data.title: InputEvent: rename axis, scancode and button_index to index in 3.0
data.body:
Is there any reason to have different names for the following variables? They are used in the same context.

InputEventJoystickButton.button_index  -> InputEventJoystickButton.index
InputEventJoystickMotion.axis -> InputEventJoystickMotion.index
InputEventMouseButton.button_index   -> InputEventMouseButton.index
InputEventKey.scancode  -> InputEventKey.index

data.title: In editor indication of unique status of resource
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Win 7 x64

**Issue description:**
Toggling Make unique on a resource in editor has results that are very much not obvious (the only way to tell is to carefully watch the resource name - i.e. press Edit after toggling make unique).

Can we please get an output message telling us the current status? Even better, the resource might have some sort of an icon in the inspector indicating the uniqueness.

**Steps to reproduce:**
See description above
